pull.title: ci: drop -priority-level from bench in win cross CI
pull.body:
So there's at least one CI sanity checking all benchmarks.

Related to #32277.

tree fe1ec02d97c48baee8e8abcadebbb126a745e21e

ci: drop -priority-level from bench in win cross CI

So there's at least one CI sanity checking all benchmarks.

Related to #32277.

events.message:
ci: drop -priority-level from bench in win cross CI

So there's at least one CI sanity checking all benchmarks.

Related to #32277.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -358,7 +358,7 @@ jobs:
           ./src/univalue/unitester.exe
 
       - name: Run benchmarks
-        run: ./bin/bench_bitcoin.exe -sanity-check -priority-level=high
+        run: ./bin/bench_bitcoin.exe -sanity-check
comments.body:
Why not drop `-priority-level=high` here as well:https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/7a3afe6787bc36fd98684eac020f9abdbfae6f0a/src/bench/CMakeLists.txt#L82-L84 ?

Will it have a significant impact on execution time?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -358,7 +358,7 @@ jobs:
           ./src/univalue/unitester.exe
 
       - name: Run benchmarks
-        run: ./bin/bench_bitcoin.exe -sanity-check -priority-level=high
+        run: ./bin/bench_bitcoin.exe -sanity-check
comments.body: I'm just changing CI, so that we catch regressions. Someone could follow up with changing this for all developers & users.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -358,7 +358,7 @@ jobs:
           ./src/univalue/unitester.exe
 
       - name: Run benchmarks
-        run: ./bin/bench_bitcoin.exe -sanity-check -priority-level=high
+        run: ./bin/bench_bitcoin.exe -sanity-check
comments.body: But this introduces another inconsistency between Windows and other platforms. Initially, `run: ./bin/bench_bitcoin.exe -sanity-check -priority-level=high` was written to mimic the `bench_sanity_check_high_priority` test task behaviour.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -358,7 +358,7 @@ jobs:
           ./src/univalue/unitester.exe
 
       - name: Run benchmarks
-        run: ./bin/bench_bitcoin.exe -sanity-check -priority-level=high
+        run: ./bin/bench_bitcoin.exe -sanity-check
comments.body: Can you explain your issue with running more tests in this CI?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -358,7 +358,7 @@ jobs:
           ./src/univalue/unitester.exe
 
       - name: Run benchmarks
-        run: ./bin/bench_bitcoin.exe -sanity-check -priority-level=high
+        run: ./bin/bench_bitcoin.exe -sanity-check
comments.body:
If it only takes a couple of extra seconds, why run a different set of tests for each platform?

Windows should, to the best of our ability, be treated the same as any other platform.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -358,7 +358,7 @@ jobs:
           ./src/univalue/unitester.exe
 
       - name: Run benchmarks
-        run: ./bin/bench_bitcoin.exe -sanity-check -priority-level=high
+        run: ./bin/bench_bitcoin.exe -sanity-check
comments.body:
> If it only takes a couple of extra seconds,

I haven't measured, for all users, developers and CIs. The point of this change is to immediately start catching regressions in at least one CI.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -358,7 +358,7 @@ jobs:
           ./src/univalue/unitester.exe
 
       - name: Run benchmarks
-        run: ./bin/bench_bitcoin.exe -sanity-check -priority-level=high
+        run: ./bin/bench_bitcoin.exe -sanity-check
comments.body:
> The point of this change is to immediately start catching regressions in at least one CI.

Ok. Resolved.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -358,7 +358,7 @@ jobs:
           ./src/univalue/unitester.exe
 
       - name: Run benchmarks
-        run: ./bin/bench_bitcoin.exe -sanity-check -priority-level=high

comments.body: The suggestion sounds reasonable. I'd be happy to review a pull doing it.
